page.title: 14EMPLOYMENT IN DRUMNADROCHIT
page.content: The area is a rural one,15 miles from {Inverness}.Within this area there is a large variety of local jobs{.Farming and{crofting}are still common (most crofters also having a second job),as is forestry.A few people work on the {Hydro Scheme}at{Cannich}.There are no longer any{Manufacturing Industries}in the area (there were some mills which have now closed). Many people are employed in local services such as contractors(plumbers etc) or shop keepers and garage owners or in local schools. The{Tourist {Industry}is important but highly seasonal, mainly employing housewives and older pupils in Summer. A large percentage of the population are employed in jobs in{Inverness}and {commute}to work in offices, building firms etc.In the village there is a percentage of retired people.
